title: Saba The Queen of Sheba’s kingdom, which comprised parts of South Arabia (now ­present-­day Yemen) and Ethiopia. Sirwah Thought to be the capital of Saba before Marib. Solomonic monarchy Ethiopia’s hereditary dynasty, begun in the tenth century b.c. by Menelik I, son of Queen Makeda and King Solomon, and ending in 1974 with Emperor Haile Selassie. Yahweh A name of God used by the Jews in Solomon’s time
